sect1.title: Volume Data
sect1.para: Volume data are three-dimensional data representing, for instance, grid spectroscopy (spectra in each image point) or time evolution of the image. So, depending on the point of view, they can be imagined as either a stack of identically-sized images or as a set of curves forming a regular grid (image).

Gwyddion currently offers some basic visualization and extraction tools in the Volume menu. Volume data windows, as shown in the following figure, provide the most basic visualisation of volume data: an preview image, representing one plane of the volume data or other associated two-dimensional data. The and coordinates of the image correspond to the and coordinates of the volume data; the coordinates can be imagined as orthogonal to the screen.

mediaobject.caption: A volume data window displaying the associated two-dimensional preview data.

sect1.para: Button Change Preview near the top of the window can be used to change the preview image. The preview can either be calculated as a summary quantity characterising data along the invisible direction (minimum, maximum, mean, â€¦), chosen as a section of the volume data, alternatively just any two-dimensional data of the same dimensions can be shown as the preview.
